The claim states that: adjusting for inflation, West Virginia’s median household income has not grown in a decade."
The expert: s verdict confirms that the claim was made in an op-ed by Democratic state Sen. Mike Romano in the Charleston Gazette-Mail.
The expert fact: checked the claim using official federal data from the Census Bureau.
The data shows that West Virginia: s median household income, adjusted for inflation, has actually decreased by 9 percent over the past decade, while the national median income has risen by 3 percent during the same period.
